Board.name: Arduino UNO R4 Minima
Board.meta_cmsisdap.sentence: Simply connect your USB Lead to the board, and this setup can be used.
Board.meta_cmsisdap.comment: No additional wiring, jumpers or drivers are required.
Board.cmsis-dap.name: ARM CMSIS-DAP compatible
Board.stlink.name: STMicroelectronics STLINK
Board.rfp.name: Renesas Flash Programmer
Board.meta_all.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-li: Libraries will be searched for in ALL Library files.
Identical to the Arduino IDE. Whilst comprehensive this can slow down deep search times.
Board.meta_top-level.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib: Libraries will be searched for in Library Root and Src Folders.
Works for most Libraries and improves Deep Search times.
Board.meta_none.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-l: Libraries will NOT be scanned for other Library #includes.
All Library interdependencies must be resolved manually, but yields fastest deep search times.
Board.meta_all.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-sk: All source files will be scanned for Libraries
Identical to the Arduino IDE. Whilst comprehensive this can slow down deep search times for large projects.
Board.meta_root.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-s: All files in the Project Root will be scanned for Libraries
Speeds up deep search where libraries are only included from Project Root Source Files.
All files in the Project Root and Src folders will be scanned for Libraries
Speeds up deep search where libraries are only included from the Project Root and Src folders.
Board.meta_ino-code-only.vm.preproc.lib-search: Only INO files in the Project will be scanned for Libraries
Faster deep search if all libraries are included only from INO code.
Board.ide.hint: Arduino IDE 2x is similar to Arduino 1x. Use Board and Library Manager to install default hardware and libraries.
Board.ide.builder.name: Arduino Builder
Board.ide.meta_custom_debugger.sentence: Provides a build that includes debug defines and will launch a custom debugger if one is provided.
Board.ide.meta_custom_debugger.paragraph: This is option is for advanced use. It is recommended that a pre-configured debugger be selected when available in this list. Usage: Optionally add a customer debugger to the project. A 'debugger_launch.json' file shares the same command syntax that is used by the VsCode debugger. Custom debuggers can be targeted at a board and/or variant and/or configuration name. IE: [variant].[configuration_name][.]debugger_launch.json
Board.ide.meta_vm_disable_opt_all.sentence: Disable compiler optimization for all sources:- Project, Library and Platform.
Board.ide.meta_vm_disable_opt_all.comment: After switching between 'No Optimization' and other optimization values, please click "Solution Clean" or switch off (or cycle) 'vMicro>Compiler>Shared Cache For Cores'. NOTE: Changing optimization settings can cause build errors or result in overly large programs.
Board.port.caption: COM4 - USB Serial Device
Board.Caption: Urządzenie szeregowe USB (COM4)
Board.Name: Urządzenie szeregowe USB (COM4)
Board.serial.port.caption: COM4 - USB Serial Device
Board.serial.Caption: Urządzenie szeregowe USB (COM4)
Board.serial.Name: Urządzenie szeregowe USB (COM4)

BreakPoint.Name: LongLineSlave.ino, line 106
BreakPoint.Message: Millis is currently {millis()}. This tutorial debug trace point prints a message every 250ms The break point property called 'Continue Execution' controls if code should pause here and wait for you to click 'Continue'. To stop debug, click stop debugging or close/stop the serial monitor. When debug ends, serial debug will continue to break/pause the mcu or transmit trace message, wifi debug will not. This breakpoint exists at the start of the loop() function, where you see a red dot. The red dot is a ‘breakpoint’. Edit the properties of a breakpoint by right clicking it or open the 'Debug>Other Windows>Breakpoint List' This breakpoint is automatically set by Visual Micro to demonstrate the Arduino debugger. Add your own breakpoints by placing the cursor on any code line and pressing F9. Press F9 again to delete the breakpoint. Read more about the Visual Micro debugger at https://www.visualmicro.com/page/Debugging-for-Arduino.aspx Take some time to learn about debugging, it’s worth it! To switch the demo breakpoint and other tips off, deselect Visual Micro>General>Tutorial Mode. Switch debugging off by changing from tool bar (Configuratin) from 'Debug' to 'Release'
BreakPoint.PreProcessedMessage: Millis is currently {0}. This tutorial debug trace point prints a message every 250ms The break point property called 'Continue Execution' controls if code should pause here and wait for you to click 'Continue'. To stop debug, click stop debugging or close/stop the serial monitor. When debug ends, serial debug will continue to break/pause the mcu or transmit trace message, wifi debug will not. This breakpoint exists at the start of the loop() function, where you see a red dot. The red dot is a ‘breakpoint’. Edit the properties of a breakpoint by right clicking it or open the 'Debug>Other Windows>Breakpoint List' This breakpoint is automatically set by Visual Micro to demonstrate the Arduino debugger. Add your own breakpoints by placing the cursor on any code line and pressing F9. Press F9 again to delete the breakpoint. Read more about the Visual Micro debugger at https://www.visualmicro.com/page/Debugging-for-Arduino.aspx Take some time to learn about debugging, it’s worth it! To switch the demo breakpoint and other tips off, deselect Visual Micro>General>Tutorial Mode. Switch debugging off by changing from tool bar (Configuratin) from 'Debug' to 'Release'
